_comment: Beam optimization tuning profiles for different GPU vendors
_description: Configuration for Stream C beam optimization. Parameters control when and how batch ray traversal is enabled based on GPU architecture.

default.comment: Disabled by default - enable only after profiling

nvidia.description: NVIDIA GPUs (CUDA cores, high warp efficiency)
nvidia.comment: NVIDIA benefits from larger beam widths due to warp scheduling

amd.comment: AMD wavefronts work well with moderate beam widths

intel.description: Intel GPUs (execution units, lower coherence tolerance)
intel.comment: Intel GPUs prefer smaller beams, higher coherence requirement

apple_m_series.comment: Apple GPUs benefit from unified memory and large beam widths

performance_targets.description: Performance targets for beam optimization decision
performance_targets.comment: Beam optimization should provide ~30% node traversal reduction

experimental.comment: Use only for profiling - may cause register pressure
